critique: This document is a delegation of authority from the President to heads of departments and agencies regarding conveyances requested by the Administrator of Civil Aeronautics under the Federal Airport Act. It appears to streamline the process by removing the requirement for Presidential approval. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The primary impact seems to be on executive power, slightly reducing the direct involvement of the President in these specific conveyances.
